The decision to step down, according to Google executives, is about streamlining management. "As Google has grown, managing the business has become more complicated," wrote Eric Schmidt in a blog post on Thursday. So Larry, Sergey Brin and I have been talking for a long time about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making, and over the holidays we decided now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured. Eric Schmidt 's tenure at Google has been nothing short of extraordinary. Andy Coulson has withstood months of strain over allegations-- which he denies-- that while editor at the News of the World he encouraged reporters to hack the cellphone messages of royals, politicians and celebrities. Unfortunately, continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110 percent needed in this role, Andy Coulson said in a statement confirming his resignation. "I stand by what I've said about those events but when the spokesman needs a spokesman, it's time to move on."
